description: This alarm indicates that the number of cells with
uncorrectable HEC erros has exceeded the used defined
the threshold.

event.Summary: Threshold of cells with uncorrectable HEC errors exceeded

description: The current operational state of the interface.
The testing(3) state indicates that no operational
packets can be passed.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifOperStatus

description: The value of this object represents the threshold value for
the number of unknown cells in a 15 minutes interval.
An SNMP trap would be generated if the number of unknown
cell in a 15 minutes interval exceeds this threshold.
The valid range of this object is 0 to 1000. A value of 0 will
cause a trap to be sent on each occurrence of an unknown cell.
A value of -9999 disables the threshold check.
The default value for this object is 10
variables.name: PDN-ATMEXT-MIB::pdnAtmIfConfExtUnknownCellThreshold

description: This alarm indicates that the line rate of the specified
interface has dropped below a value which violates the
traffic contracts of the admitted connections in the egress
(transmit) direction

event.Summary: Transmit line rate of interface $v1 is below threshold

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This alarm indicates that the traffic contract(s)
associated with the Virtual Path (VP) Cross Connect
cannot be satisfied by the ATM switch.
It is left upto the implementation to decide whether or
not the VP cross connect will be admitted

event.Summary: Virtual Path has no available bandwidth

description: The desired administrative status of this
bi-directional VP cross-connect.
variables.name: ATM-MIB::atmVpCrossConnectAdminStatus

description: This alarm indicates that the traffic contract(s)
associated with the Virtual Channel (VC) Cross Connect
cannot be satisfied by the ATM switch.
It is left upto the implementation to decide whether or
not the VC cross connect will be admitted

event.Summary: Virtual Channel has no available bandwidth

description: The desired administrative status of this
bi-directional VC cross-connect.
variables.name: ATM-MIB::atmVcCrossConnectAdminStatus

description: This alarm indicates that the line rate of the specified
interface has dropped below a value which violates the
traffic contracts of the admitted connections in the ingress
(receive) direction

event.Summary: Receive line rate of interface $v1 is below threshold

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This alarm indicates that the line rate of the specified
interface has risen above a value which would no longer violate the
traffic contracts of the admitted connections in the egress
(transmit) direction

event.Summary: Transmit line rate of interface $v1 is normal

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This alarm indicates that the line rate of the specified
interface has risen above a value which would no longer violate the
traffic contracts of the admitted connections in the ingress
(receive) direction

event.Summary: Receive line rate of interface $v1 is normal

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex
